required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Preoperative Gabapentin Versus Pregabalin on Shoulder Pain After Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Preoperative Gabapentin Versus Pregabalin on Shoulder Pain After Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy. A Randomized Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to evaluate the effect of premedication with pregabalin or gabapentin versus placebo on postoperative shoulder pain after laparoscopic cholecystectomy.

detailed_description.textblock: Preoperative premedication with gabapentins reduces preoperative anxiety, stress response to surgical stimuli, decreases anesthetic use. The incidence of postoperative nausea and vomiting appears to be decreased. The other desired effect of gabapentins is the reduction in the intensity of postoperative pain after laparoscopic surgery.

primary_outcome.time_frame: VAS score with rest at 2h, 6h, 12h, 24h and 48 hours after surgery
primary_outcome.description: Primary outcome is the intensity of shoulder pain during the first 48 hours after laparoscopic cholecystectomy using the visual analog scale (VAS).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: one hour after tracheal tube removal
secondary_outcome.description: Remifentanil requirements during anesthesia were calculated (Âµg/kg/mn)

secondary_outcome.measure: Post operative sleep quality during the first night
secondary_outcome.description: Patient's sleep quality was assessed during the first postoperative night by the Spiegel score.
The intensity of post operative nausea and vomiting was assessed by a 0 to 3 score (0: no nausea or vomiting, 1: slight mild nausea, 2: moderate nausea, 3: vomiting).

arm_group.description: Patients receive 2 capsules as placebo 2 hours before anesthesia. The capsules are delivered by the hospital pharmacy.
patients receive 2 capsules of pregabalin (pregabalin 75), two hours before anesthesia.
patients receive 2 capsules of gabapentin (gabapentin 300), two hours before anesthesia.

intervention.description: In this group, premedication is performed with 2 capsules of pregabalin 2 hours before anesthetic induction.
In this group, premedication is performed with 2 capsules of gabapentin 2 hours before anesthetic induction.
In this group, no premedication is performed, but patients receive 2 capsules of placebo 2 hours before anesthetic induction.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- uncomplicated laparoscopic cholecystectomy
- American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) status < 3
Exclusion Criteria:
- acute cholecystitis
- conversion to open cholecystectomy
- history of epilepsia, psychiatric disorders and cognitive impairment
- Pregnancy and breastfeeding
- allergy to pregabalin and/or gabapentin
- Chronic pain
- Chronic medication by corticosteroids, neuroleptics or non steroidal anti inflammatory drugs

results_reference.citation: Tiippana EM, Hamunen K, Kontinen VK, Kalso E. Do surgical patients benefit from perioperative gabapentin/pregabalin? A systematic review of efficacy and safety. Anesth Analg. 2007 Jun;104(6):1545-56, table of contents. Review.

Valadan M, Banifatemi S, Yousefshahi F. Preoperative Gabapentin to Prevent Postoperative Shoulder Pain After Laparoscopic Ovarian Cystectomy: A Randomized Clinical Trial. Anesth Pain Med. 2015 Dec 5;5(6):e31524. doi: 10.5812/aapm.31524. eCollection 2015 Dec.

Agarwal A, Gautam S, Gupta D, Agarwal S, Singh PK, Singh U. Evaluation of a single preoperative dose of pregabalin for attenuation of postoperative pain after laparoscopic cholecystectomy. Br J Anaesth. 2008 Nov;101(5):700-4. doi: 10.1093/bja/aen244. Epub 2008 Aug 20.
